article.headline: Alcorn St. 86, Alabama A&M 77
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. (AP) -- Delvin Thompson scored 22 points and helped Alcorn State break a three-game losing streak with an 86-77 win over Alabama A&M on Saturday. Alabama A&M (8-17, 2-11 Southwestern Athletic Conference) led 40-38 at the half but couldn't hang on for the win. Juan Wyatt scored 20 points for Alcorn and grabbed 10 rebounds and Cliff Douglas put 11 points on the board. Alcorn (9-16, 8-6) scored 18 points off turnovers, with 10 of those coming in the second half. Trent Simpson led Alabama A&M with 22 points and Jonathan Inman scored 10. Alcorn hit 48 percent from the floor while Alabama A&M sank 43 percent of its shots.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
